title: Jacob Helberg, Trump's direct link to France's far right
subhead: Everyone in the French far right who wants to get close to Donald Trump knows that Jacob Helberg is the man to speak to. The French-American, a young under secretary of state for economic affairs, serves as a conduit for the reactionary, nationalist and anti-immigration vision that the president wants to impose on Europe.

title: After the Epstein revelations, Jack Lang leaves a mixed record at the Arab World Institute
Lindsey Vonn's Olympic comeback ends in a violent crash
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
subhead: After initially denouncing what it described as 'fake outrage' from the media, the presidential administration eventually blamed the post on President Donald Trump's Truth Social account on an unidentified staffer's mistake and deleted it.

title: Iran nuclear talks: Fragile resumption of discussions between Washington and Tehran
subhead: The US announces new sanctions targeting Iranian oil exports and continues to warn of the possibility of large-scale military intervention.

title: Thailand's Orange Party, the frontrunner in Sunday's election, aims to outperform its 2023 results
subhead: The People's Party, the progressive 'Orange' party that succeeded the dissolved Move Forward in 2024, has softened its proposals on reforming the monarchy and the military, but for most Thais, it still embodies the camp of change.

title: 'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
subhead: Europe continues to struggle to find its own voice on the international stage because it remains trapped in a cognitive dependence on Washington, writes Rosa Balfour, director of the Carnegie Europe think tank.

'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhead: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

title: Julian Barnes bids farewell: 'There's no such thing as a perfect novel'
subhead: The British writer has published what he says will be his final book, 'Departure(s)', as he celebrates his 80th birthday. He welcomed Le Monde into his home in London for a wide-ranging conversation on his career as a writer and his body of work.
